intro: Senefeldera skutchiana, commonly known as the Skutch's senefeldera, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
